attributes.action: abolition of wheelclamping in nhs hospitals
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Despite guidelines to the contrary, we witnessed an elderly couple get wheel clamped at southmead
    hospital,Bristol and be forced to pay a release fee. The car parks were full and they were forced to park in a laybye. Managers
    are treating our nhs like markets,involving private company’s
    contracted to run hospital car parks.     We know it is
    both morally wrong and unjust to charge people to use
    facilities and services they have after all already paid for and not objected to.
    This is blatant commercial exploitation of the unfortunate who have to use the nhs. For the sake of good society let’s get these
    scams abolished! Its coming up to election year again.
    Never in human history has it been so important to be careful who gets in power, with all this Intrusiveness by the state upon our privacy ! Never vote for anyone you do not
    know! Secondly; as a suggestion, I would like everybody to ask
    canvassers and candidates at the next parliamentary election to agree
    there is no moral and justifiable reason for wheelclamping in hospitals and, most important, tell them that
    they; WILL NOT GET OUR VOTE UNLESS THEY SIGN OUR PETITION FOR
    THE ABOLITION OF NHS CAR PARK CHARGES AND WHEELCLAMPING.
